page.title: 04LAW AND ORDER
page.content: We interviewed P.C. Pinkney who enjoys his work, although it can get tiring. Police do a 2 year course to qualify; but they never stop learning throughout their career. Murder is very rare in this area, although it has happened. There are many petty thefts and burglaries by both professional and young occasional criminals.Road accidents are more common in winter than in summer and some are hit and run offences. There are assaults caused by drink or drugs (drugs are on sale here).Some police officers have been assaulted, a few seriously. The police deal with a lot of lost property including dogs. Lost dogs are taken in, kept for 48 hours and then sent to the kennels. All police stations are linked through the H.Q. telex. The nearest Crown Court is at Watford.
